author: bmwlego
title: Coasters that Look Like LEGO, are Made by LEGO but are not Compatible with LEGO
review: My friend Louann bought me this for Christmas. These coasters are awesome and look great around my apartment. They are rubbery and they have studs but the studs are not LEGO sized, they are too large. The coasters measure roughly the same size as a 16x16 baseplate and come in a light blue and a red, 2 of each color.

author: alva
title: Nice Coaster to show to your guests that you are a real Lego Fans
review:
How to make the guests that come to your house that you are an AFOL?
Yes, it is simpler to put your Lego sets here and there, making your house to look like a personal Lego museum.
But, if you are like me, collecting the Lego sets in their boxes and seldomly unpack them, probably this is one of the best way of stating that you are a Lego fans. Offer them a drink. A cup of coffee, an orange juice, anything lah, and then put the coaster on the table. It definitely will start a conversation around Lego.

I like the design of the coaster. Simple, yet very Lego. And don't think that this coaster can be used as a baseplate. They are made from rubber, so they are not sturdy, but kind of wobbly, and the size of the stud is not fit for real Lego bricks.
